Description: Lip and wall sherd of large pottery plate; fine clay with some white and small mica inclusions; covered with a pale orange slip; broad flat rim and shallow bowl decorated with two sets of grooves on exterior; inscription cut on top of lip.
Curator's comments: The base 1886,0401.924 is from a similar piece

See also A. Johnston, 'The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta', in A. Villing and U. Schlotzhauer (eds), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt. Studies on East Greek Pottery and Exchange in the Easten Mediterranean. (London 2006), p. 24, fig. 11. Place of production uncertain. Johnston (2006, 25) has suggested a possible Knidian manufacture but the clay analysis of the piece by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, (see Schlotzhauer and Villing 2006, 55, sample Nauk 73) showed it to belong to a chemical group of unknown provenance, but the group has recently been associated with Cilicia.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 236)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 662, no. 197)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55 Table 1 (Nauk 73))
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (24, fig. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.545)
